item.title: 以色列将为伊朗和加沙战争增加 125 亿美元预算
item.description: 以色列将在未来两年内增加 420 亿谢克尔（125 亿美元）的国防开支，以应对上个月与伊朗的战争和当前的加沙冲突。【原文：Israel will boost defense expenditure by 42 billion shekels ($12.5 billion) over the next two years to meet the costs of last month’s war with Iran and the ongoing conflict in Gaza.】

item.title: 德国默茨表示，欧盟必须利用现有资金开展工作
item.description: 德国总理弗里德里希-梅尔茨（Friedrich Merz）回绝了欧盟委员会新提出的 2 万亿欧元（2.3 万亿美元）预算计划，驳斥了任何向德国公司征税的企图。【原文：German Chancellor Friedrich Merz rebuffed the European Commission’s new €2 trillion ($2.3 trillion) budget plan, dismissing any attempt to tax his country’s companies.】

item.title: 任天堂 Switch 点燃 GameStop 和百思买销售高峰
item.description: 这就是开关效应。【原文：Call it the Switch effect.】

item.title: 特种部队退伍军人领导美国竞购刚果钴矿企业
item.description: 一个由前特种部队人员组成的美国财团正在寻求收购 Chemaf Resources Ltd.，该公司是一家铜钴生产商，已成为中美两国在刚果民主共和国日益激烈的矿产交易竞争中的一个象征。【原文：A US consortium involving ex-special forces personnel is seeking to acquire Chemaf Resources Ltd., a copper and cobalt producer that has become a symbol of the growing competition for mineral deals between the US and China in the Democratic Republic of Congo.】

item.title: 俄罗斯批准对 "极端主义 "搜索和 VPN 推广行为处以罚款
item.description: 俄罗斯国家杜马批准对搜索被认为是 "极端主义 "的内容和允许访问这些内容的虚拟专用网络提供商处以新的罚款，因为当局正在深化对互联网的长期打击。【原文：Russia’s State Duma approved new fines for searching for content considered “extremist” and virtual private network providers that enable access to that material as authorities deepen a long-running crackdown on the internet.】

item.title: 他信兜售黄金签证、提高旅行费用以促进泰国发展
item.description: 泰国前总理他信-西那瓦（Thaksin Shinawatra）建议泰国设立黄金签证计划，让富有的外国人成为长期居民，并呼吁泰国机场公司（Airports of Thailand Pcl）提高旅客服务费，以提振疲软的经济。【原文：Former Thai Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra suggested the country create a golden visa scheme for wealthy foreigners to become long-term residents and called on Airports of Thailand Pcl to hike passenger service fees to boost the sluggish economy.】

item.title: 萨默斯警告特朗普利率将引发 "大规模通胀心理
item.description: 前财政部长劳伦斯-萨默斯（Lawrence Summers）警告说，唐纳德-特朗普总统对美联储利率设置的偏好将引发对通胀预期的飙升，从而推高长期借贷成本。【原文：Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers warned that President Donald Trump’s preference for the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate setting would trigger a surge in expectations for inflation, driving up long-term borrowing costs.】

item.title: 美国法院就 9,300 万美元采矿纠纷作出有利于津巴布韦的裁决
item.description: 美国一家法院驳回了两家毛里求斯公司寻求执行一项针对津巴布韦国有矿业公司的长达十年之久的仲裁裁决的案件。【原文：A US court has dismissed a case brought by two Mauritian companies seeking to enforce a decade-old arbitration award against a Zimbabwean state-owned miner.】

item.title: 据说埃尼公司与贝莱德旗下 GIP 公司的交易将使碳部门估值达到 10 亿欧元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，埃尼公司（Eni SpA）向贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：Eni SpA’s deal to sell half of its carbon capture and storage unit to BlackRock Inc.’s Global Infrastructure Partners will likely value the business at around €1 billion ($1.2 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 雪佛龙在二叠纪石油产量接近顶峰，增加数十亿美元现金流
item.description: 雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp. ）即将在美国最大的油田达到产量高峰，从而在未来几年内获得数十亿美元的额外现金流。【原文：Chevron Corp. is on the cusp of reaching a production plateau in the largest US oil field, allowing it to reap billions of dollars of additional cash flow in the next few years.】

item.title: 匈牙利最大银行首席执行官呼吁采用欧元并提高可预测性
item.description: 匈牙利最大贷款机构的新任首席执行官呼吁采用欧元，并结束维克托-欧尔班（Viktor Orban）总理领导下的临时决策，因为这种决策削弱了投资者的信心，降低了估值。【原文：The new chief executive officer of Hungary’s largest lender called for the adoption of the euro and for an end to ad-hoc policymaking under Prime Minister Viktor Orban that has sapped investor confidence and dented valuations.】

item.title: 博姿增加美元贷款发行，进一步缩减债券规模
item.description: 出售支持 Sycamore Partners 收购 Boots 的定期贷款的银行提高了美元计价部分的最低规模，同时第二次削减了其债券发行的总体规模。【原文：Banks selling the term loans backing Sycamore Partners’ acquisition of Boots have increased the minimum size of the dollar-denominated portion, while cutting the overall size of its bond issuance for the second time.】

item.title: 加纳将在紧急会议前降低利率，收益率下降
item.description: 加纳央行可能会在本周举行的一次会议上大幅降息，此前这个西非国家的通胀已明显降温。【原文：Ghana’s central bank could deliver a sharp cut in interest rates at a meeting it pulled forward to this week, after inflation cooled significantly in the West African nation.】

item.title: 瑞典称欧盟在与美国的贸易谈判中必须 "坦率、迅速
item.description: 瑞典财政部长表示，欧盟需要在与美国的关税谈判中迅速开展工作并保持立场坚定，因为欧盟希望结束旷日持久的贸易谈判所引发的代价高昂的不确定性。【原文：Sweden’s finance chief said the European Union needs to work quickly and stand firm in its tariff negotiations with the US as the bloc seeks to end the costly uncertainty triggered by the protracted trade talks.】

item.title: 银行在推动私人信贷交易中玩起了长线游戏
item.description: 本周，华尔街最大的六家银行宣布，他们在动荡的第二季度通过交易固定收益产品获得了超过 200 亿美元的收入，而在这些数字中，债务世界中最炙手可热的一个领域却明显缺席：私人信贷。【原文：When the six largest Wall Street banks announced this week they had collected over $20 billion of revenue by trading fixed-income products in a volatile second quarter, one of the most in-demand segments of the debt world was conspicuously absent from those figures: private credit.】

item.title: Meta 投资者与扎克伯格及公司官员达成诉讼和解
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司投资者的一名律师称，他的客户已与该公司的现任和前任董事达成和解，结束了在特拉华州的数十亿美元的诉讼案。【原文：A lawyer for Meta Platforms Inc. investors says that his clients have reached a settlement with current and former directors at the company to end a multibillion dollar case in Delaware.】

item.title: Blackstone 的人工智能巨头在没有 30 亿美元资金的情况下继续前行
item.description: QTS 创始人 Chad Williams 和 Blackstone Inc.自私募股权公司以 100 亿美元收购以来的四年里，该公司已成为北美最大的数据中心业主和人工智能热潮中的一股力量。【原文：QTS Founder Chad Williams and Blackstone Inc. were on a hot streak. In the four years since the private equity firm’s $10 billion takeover, the company had become North America’s biggest data center landlord and a force in the artificial intelligence boom.】

item.title: 英国里夫斯宣布建立南非基础设施合作伙伴关系以促进投资
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）宣布与南非政府建立基础设施合作伙伴关系，以促进对非洲最大经济体的投资。【原文：UK Chancellor Rachel Reeves announced an infrastructure partnership with the South African government to boost investment in Africa’s biggest economy.】

item.title: 预算法案通过后美国住宅建筑商信心略有上升
item.description: 7 月份，美国住宅建筑商的信心从两年多来的低点回升，尽管越来越多的公司正在降价促销，以吸引购房者放弃观望。【原文：Confidence among US homebuilders in July edged up from a more than two-year low, though a growing share of companies are cutting prices to nudge buyers off the sidelines.】

item.title: 零售销售增长强劲，S&P 500 指数屡创新高
item.description: 由于 6 月份零售销售反弹，缓解了人们对消费支出放缓的担忧，美国股市周四震荡走高，接近历史新高。【原文：US stocks drifted higher on Thursday to trade near fresh all-time highs as retail sales rebounded in June, easing concerns about a slowdown in consumer spending.】

item.title: 埃及扩大增值税税基，在国际货币基金组织支持下寻求新的收入来源
item.description: 埃及修订了香烟和酒精饮料的增值税，同时引入了原油税，这是国际货币基金组织支持的改革中增加收入的最新举措。【原文：Egypt amended value-added taxes on cigarettes and alcoholic drinks while introducing a levy on crude oil, the latest bid to boost revenue as part of International Monetary Fund-backed reforms.】

item.title: 伊拉克与库尔德人就石油计划达成一致，向出口协议迈出一步
item.description: 伊拉克批准了一项库尔德半自治地区向巴格达输送石油的计划，这是向恢复中断两年多的出口迈出的一步。【原文：Iraq approved a plan for its semi-autonomous Kurdish region to transfer oil to Baghdad, a step toward resuming exports that have been halted for more than two years.】

item.title: 美联储主席库格勒称在 "一段时间 "内保持利率不变是合适的

item.title: 意大利市场管理局考虑暂停联合信贷银行对 BPM 的竞购
item.description: 意大利市场监管机构 Consob 正在分析是否要暂停意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）对 Banco BPM SpA 的收购要约，因为意大利一家法院对政府对该交易提出的一些要求提出了质疑。【原文：Italy’s market regulator Consob is analyzing whether to suspend UniCredit SpA’s takeover bid for Banco BPM SpA, after an Italian court challenged some of the requirements imposed by the government on the deal.】

item.title: 网络安全老板对人工智能攻击和滥用的担忧与日俱增
item.description: 一项新的调查显示，近四分之一的网络安全公司老板表示，他们的公司在过去一年中遭遇了人工智能的攻击。【原文：Nearly a quarter of cybersecurity bosses said their companies have experienced an attack powered by artificial intelligence in the past year, according to a new survey in which AI risk emerged as the defining challenge.】

item.title: 美国零售销售大幅增长，超出预期
item.description: 美国零售销售反弹，出现了广泛的增长，可能会缓和一些对消费者支出缩减的担忧。【原文：US retail sales rebounded in a broad advance, potentially tempering some concerns about a retrenchment in consumer spending.】

item.title: 美国首次申请失业救济人数连续第五周下降
item.description: 美国失业救济金申请人数连续第五周下降，降至四月中旬以来的最低水平，显示出就业市场的韧性。【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits declined for a fifth straight week to the lowest level since mid-April, showing a resilient job market.】

item.title: Couche-Tard 无法超越 Seven & I，因为其自身的逆风也越来越大
item.description: Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc. 终止了对日本 Seven & i Holdings Co.【原文：Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc. ended its pursuit of Japan’s Seven & i Holdings Co., with the Canadian retailer’s ambitions giving way to mounting pressures in its own business and a protracted share slump.】

item.title: 凯文-沃什称美联储的独立性 "至关重要"，但也有限
item.description: 美联储下任主席候选人凯文-沃什（Kevin Warsh）表示，中央银行的独立性 "至关重要"。【原文：Kevin Warsh, a candidate to be the next Federal Reserve chair, said independence for the central bank is “essential.”】

item.title: 拥有 239 年历史的机构购买英国政府债券，数百万英国债务被一笔勾销
item.description: 在一个拥有两个世纪历史的政府机构将私人捐赠者的礼物投资于今年到期的金边债券后，英国的债务储备将被抹去数百万英镑。【原文：Millions of pounds will be wiped off the UK’s debt stockpile after a two-centuries-old government body invested a gift from private donors into a gilt maturing this year.】
